1.verse: I made the first account about everything, O Theophilus, which Jesus began both to do and teach

2.verse: until which day He was taken-up [after] having given-commands through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom He chose—

3.verse: to whom He indeed presented Himself alive after His suffering by many convincing-proofs, appearing to them during forty days, and speaking the things concerning the kingdom of God.

4.verse: Jesus Ascends After Directing His Apostles To Be His Witnesses By The Spirit’s Power - And being assembled-with them, He ordered them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait-for the promise of the Father “which you heard from Me.

5.verse: Because John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit after these not many days!”

6.verse: So indeed the ones having come together were asking Him, saying “Lord, are You restoring the kingdom to Israel at this time?”.

7.verse: And He said to them, “It is not yours to know the times or seasons which the Father appointed by His own authority.

8.verse: But you will receive power, the Holy Spirit having come upon you. And you will be My witnesses— both in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and as far as the last place of the earth”.

9.verse: And having said these things, while they were looking He was lifted-up. And a cloud received Him from their eyes.

10.verse: And as they were looking-intently into heaven, while He was going— and behold, two men in white clothing were standing near them,

11.verse: who also said, “Galilean men, why do you stand looking into heaven? This Jesus having been taken-up from you into heaven will come in this manner— the way you saw Him going into heaven”.

12.verse: The Apostles Return to Jerusalem And Await The Holy Spirit In Prayer - Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain being called ‘of Olives’, which is near Jerusalem (having a Sabbath’s day journey).

13.verse: And when they went in the city, they went up to the upper-room where they were staying— both Peter and John, and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.

14.verse: These all were devoting-themselves with-one-accord to prayer, along with women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and His brothers.

15.verse: Peter Suggests That According To Scripture, Judas Should Be Replaced - And during these days, Peter, having stood up in the midst of the brothers (and the crowd of names at the same place was about one-hundred twenty), said,

16.verse: “Men, brothers, the Scripture had-to be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit spoke-beforehand through the mouth of David concerning Judas, the one having become a guide for the ones having arrested Jesus,

17.verse: because he was numbered among us, and received his share of this ministry”.

18.verse: ( Now indeed this one acquired a field with the wages of unrighteousness. And having become prostrate, he burst-open in the middle and all his inward-parts spilled-out.

19.verse: And it became known to all the ones dwelling-in Jerusalem, so that that field was called ‘Hakeldama’ in their own language, that is, ‘Field of Blood’).

20.verse: “For it has been written in the book of Psalms, ‘Let his residence become desolate, and let there not be the one dwelling in it’ [Ps 69:25], and ‘let another take his office’ [Ps 109:8].

21.verse: Therefore, from the men having accompanied us during all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and went out among us,

22.verse: beginning from the baptism of John until the day that He was taken-up from us— one of these must become a witness of His resurrection with us”.

23.verse: Matthias Is Chosen - And they put-forward two: Joseph (the one being called Barsabbas, who was called Justus), and Matthias.

24.verse: And having prayed, they said, “You, Lord, heart-knower of all— appoint the one whom You chose from these two

25.verse: to take the place of this ministry and apostleship from which Judas turned-aside to go to his own place”.

26.verse: And they gave lots for them. And the lot fell upon Matthias, and he was added with the eleven apostles.

1.verse: On Pentecost The Spirit Empowers Them To Speak To The Crowd In Their Native Languages - And during the day of Pentecost being fulfilled, they were all together at the same place.

2.verse: And suddenly a noise from heaven like of a violent rushing wind took place, and filled the whole house where they were sitting.

3.verse: And dividing tongues as-if of fire appeared to them. And it sat on each one of them.

4.verse: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit was giving the uttering to them.

5.verse: Now there were Jews dwelling in Jerusalem, reverent men from every nation under heaven.

6.verse: And this sound having taken place, the crowd came together and was confounded because they were each one hearing them speaking in his own language!

7.verse: And they were astonished, and were marveling, saying “Behold, are not all these ones speaking Galileans?

8.verse: And how is it we are each one hearing in our own language in which we were born?—

9.verse: Parthians and Medes and Elamites; and the ones dwelling-in Mesopotamia, and Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

10.verse: and Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the regions of Libya toward Cyrene; and the Romans residing here;

11.verse: both Jews and proselytes, Cretans and Arabs; we are hearing them speaking the great things of God in our own tongues”.

12.verse: And they were all astonished and greatly-perplexed, saying one to another, “What does this mean?”

13.verse: But others, while scoffing, were saying that “They have been filled with sweet-new-wine”.

14.verse: Peter Declares To The Crowd That This Event Is God Pouring Out His Promised Spirit - And Peter, having stood with the eleven, raised his voice and declared to them, “Men, Jews, and all the ones dwelling-in Jerusalem: let this be known to you, and pay-attention-to my words.

15.verse: For these ones are not drunk, as you are assuming. For it is the third hour of the day.

16.verse: But this is the thing having been spoken through the prophet Joel [in Joel 2:28-32]:

17.verse: ‘And it shall be in the last days, God says, that I will pour-out from My Spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters will prophesy, and your young men will see visions, and your older men will dream with dreams.

18.verse: And indeed upon My male-slaves and upon My female-slaves I will pour-out from My Spirit in those days, and they will prophesy.

19.verse: And I will give wonders in the heaven above, and signs on the earth below— blood, and fire and a vapor of smoke.

20.verse: The sun will be changed into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.

21.verse: And it shall be that everyone who calls-upon the name of the Lord will be saved’.

22.verse: Listen Everyone: You Killed Jesus The Nazarene, But God Raised Him From The Dead - “Men, Israelites, listen-to these words: As to Jesus the Nazarene, a man having been attested by God to you with miracles and wonders and signs which God did through Him in your midst, just as you yourselves know—

23.verse: this One, given-over by the determined purpose and foreknowledge of God, you killed, having fastened Him to a cross by the hand of Lawless ones,

24.verse: Whom God raised-up, having put-an-end-to the pains of death, because it was not possible that He be held-on-to by it.

25.verse: David Predicted This. And Jesus Poured Out What You Both See And Hear - “For David says with reference to Him [in Ps 16:8-11], ‘I was seeing the Lord in my presence continually, because He is on my right side so that I may not be shaken.

26.verse: For this reason my heart was cheered and my tongue rejoiced-greatly. And furthermore, my flesh will also dwell in hope,

27.verse: because You will not abandon my soul to Hades, nor give Your holy One to see decay.

28.verse: You made the ways of life known to me. You will make me full of gladness with Your presence’.

29.verse: Men, brothers, it is proper to say to you with confidence about the patriarch David that he both came-to-an-end and was buried. And his tomb is with us to this day.

30.verse: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God swore to him with an oath to seat One from the fruit of his loins upon his throne,

31.verse: having foreseen it, he spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ— that He was neither abandoned to Hades, nor did His flesh see decay.

32.verse: God raised up this Jesus, of which we are all witnesses.

33.verse: Therefore having been exalted to the right hand of God, and having received the promise of the Holy Spirit from the Father, He poured-out this which you are both seeing and hearing.

34.verse: For David did not go up into the heavens, but he himself says [in Ps 110:1], ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Be sitting on My right side

35.verse: until I put Your enemies as a footstool of Your feet”’.

36.verse: Therefore, Let All Israel Know That God Made Jesus Both Lord And Messiah - “Therefore let all the house of Israel know with-certainty that God made Him both Lord and Christ— this Jesus Whom you crucified”.

37.verse: Peter Urges The Crowd To Repent And Be Baptized. About 3,000 Respond - And having heard it, they were pierced in the heart, and said to Peter and the other apostles, “Men, brothers, what should we do?”

38.verse: And Peter says to them, “Repent, and let each of you be baptized on-the-basis-of  the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

39.verse: For the promise is for you, and for your children, and for all the ones far-away— all-whom the Lord our God will call-to Himself ”.

40.verse: And he solemnly-testified with many other words, and was exhorting them, saying, “Be saved from this crooked generation”.

41.verse: So indeed, the ones having welcomed his word were baptized. And about three-thousand souls were added on that day.

42.verse: Life In The First Church: The Apostles Teach and Do Miracles, Believers Learn And Love - Now they were devoting-themselves to the teaching of the apostles and to fellowship, to the breaking of the bread and to prayers.

43.verse: And awe was taking place in every soul. And many wonders and signs were taking place through the apostles.

44.verse: And all the ones believing were at the same place, and were having all things common.

45.verse: And they were selling properties and possessions, and distributing them to all— as anyone was having a need.

46.verse: And while continuing daily with-one-accord in the temple and breaking bread house by house, they were sharing-in food with gladness and simplicity of heart,

47.verse: while praising God and having favor with the whole people. And the Lord was adding the ones being saved daily at-the-same-place.

1.verse: Peter Heals a Man Lame From Birth In The Name of Jesus Christ The Nazarene - Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

2.verse: And a certain man being lame from his mother’s womb was being carried, whom they were putting daily at the gate of the temple being called “Beautiful”, that he might be asking-for alms from the ones coming into the temple—

3.verse: who, having seen Peter and John being about to go into the temple, was asking to receive alms.

4.verse: And Peter, along with John, having looked-intently at him, said, “Look at us!”

5.verse: And the one was fixing-his-attention-on them, expecting to receive something from them.

6.verse: And Peter said, “There is no silver and gold with me. But what I have, this I give to you— in the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, arise and walk”.

7.verse: And having seized him by the right hand, he raised him. And at once his feet and ankles were made-strong.

8.verse: And leaping-up, he stood and was walking-around. And he entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping and praising God.

9.verse: And all the people saw him walking and praising God.

10.verse: And they were recognizing him— that he was the one sitting for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. And they were filled with wonder and astonishment at the thing having happened to him.

11.verse: A Crowd Comes Together, And Peter Speaks To Them: - And while he was holding-on-to Peter and John, all the people ran-together to them at the portico being called “Solomon’s”, struck-with-wonder.

12.verse: And having seen it, Peter responded to the people— God Raised Jesus, The One You Denied And Killed. And Jesus Healed This Man -“Men, Israelites, why are you marveling at this? Or why are you looking-intently at us as-if we caused him to walk by our own power or godliness?

13.verse: The God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob, the God of our fathers— He glorified His servant Jesus, Whom you indeed handed-over and denied in the presence of Pilate, that one having determined to release Him.

14.verse: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked that a man who was a murderer be granted to you.

15.verse: And you killed the Author of life, Whom God raised from the dead— of which we are witnesses.

16.verse: And on-the-basis-of [our] faith in His name, His name made this one strong whom you see and know. And the faith that comes through Him gave him this wholeness in front of all of you.

17.verse: The Prophets Said The Christ Would Suffer, Which God Now Fulfilled. Therefore Repent - “And now, brothers, I know that you acted in-accordance-with ignorance, just as also your rulers.

18.verse: But God fulfilled in this manner the things which He announced-beforehand through the mouth of all the prophets— that His Christ would suffer.

19.verse: Therefore repent and turn-back so that your sins may be wiped-out,

20.verse: so that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord, and He may send-forth the Christ having been appointed for you— Jesus,

21.verse: Whom it-is-necessary that heaven receive until the times of restoration of all things, of which God spoke through the mouth of His holy prophets from the past age.

22.verse: Moses And The Prophets Announced This Day. God Has Sent Jesus To You First - “Moses said [in Deut 18:15-19] that ‘The Lord your God will raise-up a prophet for you from your brothers like me. You shall listen-to Him in relation to all that He says to you.

23.verse: And it will be that every soul who does not listen-to that prophet will be utterly-destroyed out of the people’.

24.verse: And indeed all the prophets from Samuel and his successors who spoke also announced these days.

25.verse: You are the sons of the prophets, and of the covenant which God covenanted with your fathers, saying to Abraham [in Gen 22:18], ‘And all the families of the earth will be blessed in your seed’.

26.verse: God, having raised-up His Servant, sent Him forth to you first— blessing you in turning-away each of you from your evil-ways”.

1.verse: The Jewish Leaders Jail Peter And John For Proclaiming The Resurrection - And while they were speaking to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple [guard] and the Sadducees suddenly-came-upon them,

2.verse: being greatly-disturbed because of their teaching the people and proclaiming the resurrection from the dead in Jesus.

3.verse: And they put their hands on them, and put them in jail until the next day. For it was already evening.

4.verse: But many of the ones having heard the word believed. And the number of the men became about five thousand.

5.verse: Peter Responds: Jesus, Whom You Crucified And God Raised, Healed This Man - And it came about on the next day that their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem—

6.verse: and Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and all who were of the high-priestly family.

7.verse: And having stood them in the middle, they were inquiring, “By what power or by what name did you do this?”

8.verse: Then Peter, having been filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people, and elders:

9.verse: If we are being examined today for a good-deed to a weak man, by what means this one has been restored,

10.verse: let it be known to you all and to all the people of Israel that by the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene— Whom you crucified, Whom God raised from the dead— by this One this one stands before you healthy.

11.verse: This One is the stone— the One having been treated-with-contempt by you, the builders; the One having become the head of the corner.

12.verse: And there is no salvation in any other, for neither is there another name under heaven having been given among people by which we must be saved”.

13.verse: The Jewish Leaders Ponder What To Do In View of This Undeniable Miracle - Now observing the boldness of Peter and John, and having understood that they were uneducated and untrained men, they were marveling. And they were recognizing them, that they had been with Jesus.

14.verse: And seeing the man standing there with them, the one having been cured, they were having nothing to speak-against it.

15.verse: But having ordered them to go outside of the council [chamber], they were conferring with one another,

16.verse: saying, “What should we do with these men? For that a known sign has taken place through them is evident to all the ones dwelling-in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it—

17.verse: but in order that it may not spread further to the people, let us threaten them to no longer be speaking on the basis of this name to any of mankind”.

18.verse: They Command Peter And John Not To Speak Or Teach About Jesus. But They Refuse - And having called them, they commanded them not to be speaking nor teaching at all on the basis of the name of Jesus.

19.verse: But having responded, Peter and John said to them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen-to you rather than God, you judge.

20.verse: For we are not able to not be speaking the things which we saw and heard”.

21.verse: And the ones, having threatened further, released them, finding nothing as to how they might punish them, because of the people— because they were all glorifying God for the thing having taken place.

22.verse: For the man was more than forty years old upon whom this sign of healing had taken place.

23.verse: Peter And John Are Released. The Believers Rejoice And Ask God For More Boldness - And having been released, they went to their own people and reported all-that the chief priests and the elders said to them.

24.verse: And the ones having heard it lifted their voice to God with-one-accord and said, “Master, You are the One having made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all the things in them;

25.verse: the One having said by the Holy Spirit from the mouth of our father David, Your servant [in Ps 2:1-2], ‘Why did the Gentiles rage, and the peoples plot futile things?

26.verse: The kings of the earth took-their-stand, and the rulers were gathered-together at the same place against the Lord, and against His Anointed-One’.

27.verse: For in accordance with [Your] truth, both Herod and Pontius Pilate together with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel were gathered-together in this city against Your holy servant Jesus Whom You anointed,

28.verse: to do all-that Your hand and Your purpose predestined to take place.

29.verse: And as to the things now, Lord— look-upon their threats. And grant to Your slaves to speak Your word with all boldness

30.verse: while You are stretching-out Your hand for healing, and signs and wonders are taking place through the name of Your holy servant Jesus”.

31.verse: And they having prayed, the place in which they had been gathered-together was shaken. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit. And they were speaking the word of God with boldness.

32.verse: The Believers Sell Property To Help Any In Need Among Them - Now the heart and soul of the multitude of the ones having believed was one. And not even one of them was saying that any of the things belonging to him were his own, but all things were common to them.

33.verse: And with great power, the apostles were rendering their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And great grace was upon them all—

34.verse: for there was not even someone in-need among them. For all-who were owners of lands or houses, selling them, were bringing the proceeds of the things being sold

35.verse: and laying it at the feet of the apostles. And it was being distributed to each one as anyone was having a need.

36.verse: Barnabas Sells a Field And Brings The Money To The Apostles - Now Joseph— the one having been called Barnabas by the apostles (which being translated is “son of  encouragement”), a Levite, a Cyprian by nationality,

37.verse: a field belonging to him— having made-a-sale, brought the money and laid it at the feet of the apostles.

1.verse: Ananias And Sapphira Sell a Property, But Deceive The Church About Their Generosity - But a certain man, Ananias by name, along with his wife Sapphira, sold property.

2.verse: And he kept-back some of the proceeds, his wife also having shared-the-knowledge. And having brought a certain part of it, he laid it at the feet of the apostles.

3.verse: But Peter said, “Ananias, for what reason did Satan fill your heart that you should lie-to the Holy Spirit and keep-back some of the proceeds of the land?

4.verse: While remaining unsold, was it not remaining yours? And having been sold, was it not within your authority? Why is it that you put this thing in your heart? You did not lie to people, but to God”.

5.verse: And Ananias, hearing these words, having fallen-down, expired. And great fear came upon all the ones hearing it.

6.verse: And having arisen, the younger men wrapped him up. And having carried him out, they buried him.

7.verse: Now an interval of about three hours took place, and his wife came in— not knowing the thing having happened.

8.verse: And Peter responded to her, “Tell me whether you two sold the land for so much?” And the one said, “Yes, for so much”.

9.verse: And Peter said to her, “Why is it that it was agreed by you two to test the Spirit of the Lord? Behold— the feet of the ones having buried your husband are at the door. And they will carry you out”.

10.verse: And she fell at-once at his feet, and expired. And having come in, the young-men found her dead. And having carried her out, they buried her with her husband.

11.verse: And great fear came upon the whole church, and upon all the ones hearing-of these things.

12.verse: The Apostles Continue To Speak And Do Miracles. Multitudes Believe. Many Are Healed - Now many signs and wonders were taking place through the hands of the apostles among the people. And they were all with-one-accord in the portico of Solomon.

13.verse: But none of the rest was daring to join them, yet the people were magnifying them.

14.verse: And more people believing in the Lord were being added— multitudes of both men and women,

15.verse: so that they were even bringing-out the sick into the wide-roads and putting them on little-beds and cots, in order that while Peter was coming, if-even his shadow might overshadow one of them.

16.verse: And the multitude from the cities around Jerusalem was also coming-together, bringing sick ones and ones being troubled by unclean spirits, who all were being cured.

17.verse: The Jewish Leaders Jail The Apostles Again, But an Angel Lets Them Out - And having arisen, the high priest and all the ones with him— the sect of the Sadducees existing there— were filled with jealousy.

18.verse: And they put their hands on the apostles and put them in the public jail.

19.verse: But an angel of the Lord— having opened the doors of the prison during the night, and having led them out— said,

20.verse: “Go! And having stood, be speaking in the temple to the people all the words of this life”.

21.verse: And having heard, they entered into the temple at dawn and were teaching. The Apostles Are Found In The Temple, And Are Brought Before The Sanhedrin -And having arrived, the high priest and the ones with him called together the Sanhedrin— even the whole council-of-elders of the sons of Israel. And they sent-out officers to the jailhouse that they might be brought.

22.verse: But having arrived, the officers did not find them in the prison. And having returned, they reported,

23.verse: saying that “We found the jailhouse having been locked with all security, and the guards standing at the doors. But having opened, we found no one inside”.

24.verse: And when both the captain of the temple [guard] and the chief priests heard these words, they were greatly-perplexed about them as to what this would become.

25.verse: But having arrived, someone reported to them that “Behold— the men whom you put in the prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people”.

26.verse: Then the captain, having gone away with the officers, was bringing them— not with violence (for they were fearing the people, that they might be stoned).

27.verse: Peter Responds: God Raised Jesus As The Savior of Israel. We Are Witnesses - And having brought them, they stood them in the council [chamber]. And the high priest questioned them,

28.verse: saying, “Did we not command you with a command not to be teaching on the basis of this name? And behold— you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching. And you intend to bring the blood of this man upon us”.

29.verse: But having responded, Peter and the apostles said, “It-is-necessary to obey God rather than people.

30.verse: The God of our fathers raised Jesus— Whom you murdered, having hung Him on a cross.

31.verse: God exalted this One to His right hand as Leader and Savior, that He might grant repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.

32.verse: And we are witnesses of these things. And so is the Holy Spirit, Whom God gave to the ones obeying Him”.

33.verse: And the ones having heard it were infuriated, and were intending to kill them.

34.verse: Gamaliel Advises a Wait-And-See Approach. The Apostles Are Beaten And Released - But having stood up, a certain Pharisee in the Sanhedrin— Gamaliel by name, a Law-teacher honored by all the people— gave-orders to make the men be outside for a little while.

35.verse: And he said to them, “Men, Israelites, take heed to yourselves as to what you are about to do to these men.

36.verse: For before these days, Theudas arose saying that he was somebody, with whom a number of men joined-up (about four-hundred)— who was killed. And all who were being persuaded by him were dispersed, and they became nothing.

37.verse: After this one, Judas the Galilean arose in the days of the registration and drew-away a group-of-people after him. That one also perished, and all who were being persuaded by him were scattered.

38.verse: And as to the things now, I say to you, draw-away from these men and leave them alone. Because if this plan or this work should be from humans, it will be overthrown;

39.verse: but if it is from God, you will not be able to overthrow them— that you indeed may not perhaps be found to be fighting-against-God”. And they were persuaded by him.

40.verse: And having summoned the apostles, having beaten them, they commanded them not to be speaking on the basis of the name of Jesus, and released them.

41.verse: The Apostles Rejoice In Their Mistreatment, And Continue Proclaiming Jesus As Messiah - So indeed the ones were going from the presence of the Sanhedrin rejoicing that they were considered-worthy to be dishonored for the Name.

42.verse: And every day, in the temple and house by house, they were not ceasing teaching and announcing-the-good-news as to Jesus, the Christ.

1.verse: When Problems Arise In Serving The Needy In The Church, Deacons Are Chosen To Oversee It - Now during these days, while the disciples were multiplying, grumbling arose from the Hellenists against the Hebrews because their widows were being overlooked in the daily ministry [of food].

2.verse: And the twelve, having summoned the multitude of the disciples, said, “It is not pleasing that we, having left-behind the word of God, should be serving tables.

3.verse: But brothers, look-for seven men from-among you being attested, full of the Spirit and wisdom, whom we will put-in-charge over this need.

4.verse: And we will devote-ourselves to prayer and the ministry of the word”.

5.verse: And the statement was pleasing in the sight of the whole multitude. And they chose Stephen (a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit), and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas (a proselyte from Antioch),

6.verse: whom they stood before the apostles. And having prayed, they laid their hands on them.

7.verse: And the word of God was growing. And the number of the disciples in Jerusalem was being multiplied greatly. And a large crowd of the priests were obeying the faith.

8.verse: Stephen Is Seized While Doing Miracles And Proclaiming Christ With Irresistible Wisdom - Now Stephen, full of grace and power, was doing great wonders and signs among the people.

9.verse: But some of the ones from the synagogue being called “of Freedmen”— both Cyrenians and Alexandrians, and the ones from Cilicia and Asia— rose-up, debating with Stephen.

10.verse: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.

11.verse: Then they secretly-induced men [to begin] saying that “We have heard him speaking blasphemous words against Moses and God”.

12.verse: And they stirred-up the people and the elders and the scribes. And having suddenly-come-upon him, they seized him and brought him to the Sanhedrin.

13.verse: And they put-forward false witnesses, saying, “This man does not cease speaking words against this holy place and the Law.

14.verse: For we have heard him saying that this Jesus the Nazarene will tear-down this place, and change the customs which Moses handed-down to us”.

15.verse: And having looked-intently at him, all the ones sitting in the council [chamber] saw his face was like a face of an angel.

1.verse: And the high priest said, “Do these things hold so?”

2.verse: Stephen Defends Himself Before The Sanhedrin: - And the one said, “Men, brothers, and fathers, listen— God Promised Abraham’s Descendants Would Inherit The Land -“The God of  glory appeared to our father Abraham while being in Mesopotamia, before he dwelled in Haran,

3.verse: and said to him [in Gen 12:1], ‘Go out from your land and from your relatives, and come to the land which I will show you’.

4.verse: Then having gone out from the land of the Chaldeans, he dwelled in Haran. And from there, after his father died, He removed him to this land in which you are now dwelling.

5.verse: And He did not give him an inheritance in it, not even the step of a foot. And He promised to give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him— there not being a child for him!

6.verse: But God spoke as follows [in Gen 15:13-14]: that his seed ‘will be a foreigner in a land belonging-to-another. And they will enslave it and mistreat it for four-hundred years.

7.verse: And I will judge the nation in whichever they will serve-as-slaves’, said God. ‘And after these things, they will come out and worship Me’ in this place.

8.verse: And He gave him the covenant of circumcision. Abraham’s Children Moved To Egypt During a Famine -“And so he fathered Isaac, and circumcised him on the eighth day; and Isaac, Jacob; and Jacob, the twelve patriarchs.

9.verse: And the patriarchs, having become-jealous-of Joseph, sold him into Egypt. And God was with him,

10.verse: and rescued him from all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh, king of Egypt. And he appointed him to be ruling over Egypt, and over his whole house.

11.verse: And a famine came over all Egypt and Canaan, and a great affliction. And our fathers were not finding food.

12.verse: But Jacob, having heard-of grain being in Egypt, sent-forth our fathers first.

13.verse: And during the second visit, Joseph was made-known-again to his brothers, and the family of Joseph became known to Pharaoh.

14.verse: And having sent-forth his brothers, Joseph summoned Jacob his father and all his relatives, amounting-to seventy five souls.

15.verse: And Jacob went down to Egypt. And he came-to-an-end, and our fathers.

16.verse: And they were transferred to Shechem, and placed in the tomb which Abraham bought for a price of silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.

17.verse: When The Time Came, God Raised Up Moses, Whom The People Rejected - “Now as the time of the promise which God declared to Abraham was drawing-near, our people grew and were multiplied in Egypt,

18.verse: until which time another king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.

19.verse: This one, having dealt-shrewdly-with our nation, mistreated our fathers, so that he caused their babies to be exposed that they might not be kept-alive;

20.verse: at which time Moses was born— and he was beautiful to God— who was brought-up for three months in the house of his father.

21.verse: And he having been exposed, the daughter of Pharaoh took him up, and brought him up for herself for a son.

22.verse: And Moses was trained in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. And he was powerful in his words and deeds.

23.verse: And as a forty-year period was being fulfilled for him, it came-up on his heart to visit his brothers, the sons of Israel.

24.verse: And having seen someone being wronged, he defended him, and executed vengeance for the one being oppressed, having struck the Egyptian.

25.verse: Now he was thinking that his brothers were understanding that God was granting them deliverance by his hand. But the ones did not understand.

26.verse: And on the following day, he appeared to them while they were fighting. And he was reconciling them to peace, having said, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why are you wronging one another?’ [Ex 2:13].

27.verse: But the one wronging his neighbor rejected him, having said, ‘Who appointed you ruler and judge over us?

28.verse: You do not intend to kill me the way you killed the Egyptian yesterday, do you?’ [Ex 2:14].

29.verse: And Moses fled at this word. And he became a foreigner in the land of Midian, where he fathered two sons.

30.verse: And forty years having been fulfilled, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in the flame of fire of a bush.

31.verse: And having seen it, Moses was marveling-at the sight. And while he was approaching to look-closely, the voice of the Lord came:

32.verse: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob’. And having become trembling, Moses was not daring to look-closely.

33.verse: And the Lord said to him, ‘Untie the sandal from your feet, for the place upon which you stand is holy ground.

34.verse: Having seen, I saw the mistreatment of My people in Egypt, and I heard their groaning, and I came down to rescue them. And now, come, I will send you forth to Egypt’.

35.verse: This Moses Whom Israel Denied, God Sent To Be Both Ruler And Deliverer - “This Moses whom they denied, having said, ‘Who appointed you ruler and judge?’ [Ex 2:14]— this one God has sent-forth to be both ruler and deliverer, with the hand of the angel having appeared to him in the bush.

36.verse: This one led them out, having done wonders and signs in Egypt land, and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

37.verse: This Moses Said That God Would Raise Up a Prophet Like Him - “This one is the Moses having said to the sons of Israel, ‘God will raise-up a prophet like me for you from your brothers’ [Deut 18:15].

38.verse: This Moses Brought Israel God’s Word, Which They Rejected - “This one is the one having been in the congregation in the wilderness, with the angel speaking to him at Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living oracles to give to us—

39.verse: to whom our fathers were not willing to become obedient, but they rejected him and turned-away in their hearts to Egypt,

40.verse: having said to Aaron, ‘Make gods for us who will go before us. For this Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what happened to him’ [Ex 32:1].

41.verse: And they made-a-calf in those days, and brought-up a sacrifice to the idol. And they were celebrating in the works of their hands.

42.verse: So God Turned Away From Them And Handed Them Over To Idolatry - “And God turned-away, and handed them over to worship the host of heaven, just as it has been written in the book of the prophets [in Amos 5:25-27]: ‘House of Israel, you did not offer victims and sacrifices to Me for forty years in the wilderness, did you?

43.verse: Indeed you took-up the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god Rephan— the images which you made to give-worship to them. Indeed I will remove you beyond Babylon!’

44.verse: The Fathers Had The Tabernacle And The Temple. But God Does Not Dwell In Either - “The tabernacle of testimony was with our fathers in the wilderness, just as the One speaking to Moses directed him to make it according to the pattern which he had seen;

45.verse: which our fathers, having received-it-in-succession, also brought in with Joshua during the taking-possession of the nations whom God drove-out from the presence of our fathers— until the days of David,

46.verse: who found favor before God. And he asked that he might find a dwelling-place for the house of Jacob,

47.verse: but Solomon built a house for Him.

48.verse: But the Most-High does not dwell in things made-by-human-hands, just as the prophet says [in Isa 66:1-2]:

49.verse: ‘The heaven is a throne for Me, and the earth is a footstool of My feet. What kind of house will you build for Me?’ says the Lord, ‘or what will be the place of My rest?

50.verse: Did not My hand make all these things?’

51.verse: You Always Resist God! Your Fathers Killed The Prophets, And You The Messiah - “Stiff-necked ones, and uncircumcised in your hearts and ears— you are always resisting the Holy Spirit. As your fathers did, you also are doing.

52.verse: Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they killed the ones having announced-beforehand about the coming of the righteous One, of Whom you now became betrayers and murderers—

53.verse: you who received the Law by the directions of  angels and did not keep it!”

54.verse: Stephen Reports Seeing Jesus At The Right Hand of God. The Jews Stone Him To Death - And hearing these things, they were infuriated in their hearts, and were grinding their teeth at him.

55.verse: But being full of the Holy Spirit, having looked-intently into heaven, he saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right side of God.

56.verse: And he said, “Behold— I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing on the right side of God!”

57.verse: And having cried-out with a loud voice, they held-shut their ears, and rushed against him with-one-accord.

58.verse: And having driven him outside of the city, they were stoning him. And the witnesses laid-aside their garments at the feet of a young-man being called Saul.

59.verse: And they were stoning Stephen while he was calling-upon Jesus and saying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit”.

60.verse: And having put down his knees, he cried-out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not set this sin against them”. And having said this, he fell-asleep.

1.verse: And Saul was giving-approval to his killing. The Church Is Persecuted And Driven Out of Jerusalem -And a great persecution came about on that day against the church in Jerusalem, and they were all dispersed throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.

2.verse: And reverent men carried-in Stephen [for burial], and made a loud lamentation over him.

3.verse: And Saul was destroying the church. Entering from house to house, dragging-away both men and women, he was handing them over to prison.

4.verse: So indeed, the ones having been dispersed went about announcing the word as good news.

5.verse: Philip Proclaims Christ And Does Miracles In Samaria. Many Are Baptized, Including Simon - Now Philip, having gone down to the city of Samaria, was proclaiming the Christ to them.

6.verse: And the crowds were with-one-accord paying-attention-to the things being said by Philip, during their hearing and seeing the signs which he was doing.

7.verse: For many of the ones having unclean spirits— they were coming out while shouting with a loud voice. And many paralyzed ones and lame ones were cured.

8.verse: And there was great joy in that city.

9.verse: Now a certain man, Simon by name, was-previously in the city practicing-magic and astonishing the nation of Samaria, saying that he was someone great,

10.verse: to whom they all, from the small up to the great, were paying attention, saying, “This one is the Power of God being called ‘Great’”.

11.verse: And they were paying attention to him because he had astonished them for a considerable time with the magic-arts.

12.verse: And when they believed Philip announcing-the-good-news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were being baptized— both men and women.

13.verse: Now Simon himself also believed. And having been baptized, he was attaching-himself to Philip. He was astonished, seeing both signs and great miracles taking place.

14.verse: Peter and John Come So The Samaritans Might Receive The Holy Spirit - And the apostles in Jerusalem, having heard that “Samaria has accepted the word of God”, sent-forth Peter and John to them—

15.verse: who, having come down, prayed for them so that they might receive the Holy Spirit.

16.verse: For He had not yet fallen upon any of them, but they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

17.verse: Then they were laying their hands on them, and they were receiving the Holy Spirit.

18.verse: Now Simon, having seen that the Spirit was given through the laying-on of the hands of the apostles, offered them money,

19.verse: saying, “Give this authority to me also, so-that on whomever I lay on my hands, he may receive the Holy Spirit”.

20.verse: But Peter said to him, “May your silver be with you for destruction, because you thought to acquire the gift of God with money.

21.verse: There is no part nor share for you in this matter. For your heart is not straight before God.

22.verse: Therefore repent from this evilness of yours, and pray to the Lord, if perhaps the intention of your heart will be forgiven you.

23.verse: For I see you being in the gall of  bitterness and the bond of unrighteousness”.

24.verse: And having responded, Simon said, “You two pray to the Lord for me, so that nothing of the things which you have spoken may come upon me”.

25.verse: So indeed the ones— having solemnly-testified, and having spoken the word of the Lord— were returning to Jerusalem and announcing-the-good-news-to many villages of the Samaritans.

26.verse: An Angel Sends Philip Down The Road To an Ethiopian Eunuch Reading Isaiah - Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip saying, “Arise and go toward the south on the road going down from Jerusalem to Gaza”. This is a wilderness [road].

27.verse: And having arisen, he proceeded. And behold— there was an Ethiopian man, a eunuch, a court-official of Candace (queen of the Ethiopians), who was over all her treasury, who had come to Jerusalem to worship,

28.verse: and was returning, and sitting on his chariot. And he was reading the prophet Isaiah.

29.verse: And the Spirit said to Philip, “Approach and join this chariot”.

30.verse: And having run up, Philip heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said, “Do you indeed understand the things which you are reading?”

31.verse: And the one said, “How indeed might I be able, unless someone will guide me?” And he invited Philip to sit with him, having come up.

32.verse: Philip Explains That Isaiah 53 Refers To Jesus - Now the passage of Scripture which he was reading was this: “He was led like a sheep to slaughter. And as a lamb before the one having sheared it is silent, so He does not open His mouth.

33.verse: In His humiliation, His justice was taken-away. Who will describe His generation? Because His life is taken-away from the earth” [Isa 53:7-8].

34.verse: And having responded, the eunuch said to Philip, “I ask you, about whom is the prophet saying this— about himself or about some other?”

35.verse: And Philip— having opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture— announced Jesus as good news to him.

36.verse: The Man Believes And Is Baptized, And Continues Home Rejoicing - And as they were proceeding along the road, they came upon some water. And the eunuch says, “Behold— water. What is preventing me from being baptized?”

38.verse: And he ordered the chariot to stop. And they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

39.verse: And when they came up out-of  the water, the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away. And the eunuch did not see him any longer, for he was going his way rejoicing.

40.verse: Philip Continues Announcing The Good News In Other Cities - And Philip was found at Azotus. And while going through, he was announcing-the-good-news-to all the cities until he came to Caesarea.

1.verse: While Saul Is Going To Damascus To Persecute Believers, Jesus Appears To Him - Now Saul, still breathing threat and murder against the disciples of the Lord, having gone to the high priest,

2.verse: asked-for letters from him to the synagogues at Damascus so that if he found any being of the Way, both men and women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

3.verse: And during the proceeding, it came about that he was drawing-near to Damascus. And suddenly a light from heaven flashed-around him.

4.verse: And having fallen on the ground, he heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?”

5.verse: And he said, “Who are You, sir?” And the One said, “I am Jesus Whom you are persecuting.

6.verse: But arise and enter into the city, and it will be told you what thing you must do”.

7.verse: And the men traveling-with him were standing speechless, hearing the voice but seeing no one.

8.verse: And Saul was raised from the ground. And his eyes having been opened, he was seeing nothing. And hand-leading him, they brought him into Damascus.

9.verse: And he was not seeing for three days. And he did not eat nor drink.

10.verse: God Tells Ananias To Go Give Saul His Sight, For He Is God’s Chosen Instrument - Now a certain disciple was in Damascus— Ananias by name. And the Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias”. And the one said, “Behold, I am here, Lord”.

11.verse: And the Lord said to him, “Having arisen, go on the lane being called ‘Straight’, and seek one-from-Tarsus, Saul by name, in the house of Judas. For behold— he is praying.

12.verse: And he saw a man in a vision, Ananias by name, having come in and laid hands on him so that he might see-again”.

13.verse: And Ananias responded, “Lord, I heard about this man from many— how many bad things he did to Your saints in Jerusalem.

14.verse: And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all the ones calling-upon Your name”.

15.verse: And the Lord said to him, “Go, because this one is a chosen instrument for Me— that he might carry My name before both Gentiles and kings, and sons of Israel.

16.verse: For I will show him how-many things he must suffer for My name”.

17.verse: And Ananias departed, and entered into the house. And having laid his hands on him, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord has sent me forth— Jesus, the One having appeared to you on the road on which you were coming— so that you may see-again and be filled with the Holy Spirit”.

18.verse: And immediately something like scales fell from his eyes. And he saw-again, and having arisen, was baptized.

19.verse: And having taken food, he strengthened. Saul Begins Proclaiming Christ In Damascus. He Escapes a Plot To Kill Him -Now he came-to-be with the disciples in Damascus for some days.

20.verse: And immediately he was proclaiming Jesus in the synagogues— that this One is the Son of God.

21.verse: And all the ones hearing were astonished, and were saying, “Is not this the one having destroyed in Jerusalem the ones calling-upon this name? And he had come here for this— that he might bring them bound to the chief priests!”

22.verse: And Saul was becoming more strong. And he was confounding the Jews dwelling in Damascus, proving that this One is the Christ.

23.verse: And when considerable days were being fulfilled, the Jews plotted to kill him.

24.verse: But their plot was known by Saul. And they were even closely-watching the gates both by day and by night so that they might kill him.

25.verse: But his disciples, having taken him by night, let him down through the wall, having lowered him in a large-basket.

26.verse: Saul Joins The Disciples In Jerusalem. Due To a Plot To Kill Him, He Is Sent To Tarsus - And having arrived in Jerusalem, he was trying to join the disciples. And they all were fearing him, not believing that he was a disciple.

27.verse: But Barnabas, having taken-hold-of him, brought him to the apostles and related to them how he saw the Lord on the road, and that He spoke to him; and how in Damascus he spoke-boldly in the name of Jesus.

28.verse: And he was with them, going in and going out in Jerusalem, speaking-boldly in the name of the Lord.

29.verse: And he was speaking and debating with the Hellenists, but the ones were attempting to kill him.

30.verse: But the brothers, having learned it, brought him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus.

31.verse: The Church Enjoys Peace And Growth - So indeed the church throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria was having peace, while being built-up. And it was being multiplied while walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit.

32.verse: Peter Goes Through The Regions Healing And Proclaiming Christ. He Heals Aeneas in Lydda - Now it came about that Peter, while going through all the regions, came down also to the saints dwelling-in Lydda.

33.verse: And he found there a certain man, Aeneas by name, who had been paralyzed, lying down on a cot for eight years.

34.verse: And Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Arise and make your bed for yourself ”. And immediately he arose.

35.verse: And all the ones dwelling-in Lydda and Sharon saw him— who [then] turned to the Lord.

36.verse: Peter Raises Dorcas From The Dead In Joppa - Now in Joppa, there was a certain disciple, Tabitha by name (which being interpreted means “Dorcas”). This one was full of good works and acts-of-almsgiving which she was doing.

37.verse: And it came about in those days that having become sick, she died. And having washed her, they laid her in an upper-room.

38.verse: Now Lydda being near Joppa, the disciples, having heard that Peter was in it, sent-out two men to him urging, “Do not delay to come to us”.

39.verse: And having arisen, Peter went with them— whom, having arrived, they brought up into the upper room. And all the widows stood near him, weeping and showing him tunics and garments— all-that Dorcas was making while being with them.

40.verse: And Peter— having put everyone outside, and having put down his knees— prayed. And having turned to the body, he said, “Tabitha, rise-up”. And the one opened her eyes! And having seen Peter, she sat up.

41.verse: And having given her his hand, he raised her up. And having called the saints and the widows, he presented her alive.

42.verse: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many put-faith upon the Lord.

43.verse: And it came about that he stayed considerable days in Joppa with a certain Simon, a tanner.

1.verse: After a Vision, a Gentile Named Cornelius Sends Men To Joppa To Get Peter - Now a certain man in Caesarea, Cornelius by name— a centurion from the cohort being called “Italian”,

2.verse: a devout one, and one fearing God with all his household, doing many acts-of-almsgiving to the [Jewish] people, and praying to God continually—

3.verse: saw in a vision clearly, as-if  it were around the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God having come-in to him, and having said to him, “Cornelius!”

4.verse: And the one— having looked-intently at him, and having become terrified— said, “What is it, sir?” And he said to him, “Your prayers and your acts-of-almsgiving went up for a memorial before God.

5.verse: And now, send men to Joppa, and send-for a certain Simon who is called Peter.

6.verse: This one is lodging with a certain Simon, a tanner, whose house is beside the sea”.

7.verse: And when the angel speaking to him departed, having called two of his household-servants and a devout soldier from the ones attaching-themselves to him,

8.verse: and having described everything to them, he sent them forth to Joppa.

9.verse: Before They Arrive, Peter Has a Vision To Treat As Clean What God Has Made Clean - Now on the next day, while those ones were journeying and drawing-near to the city, Peter went up on the housetop around the sixth hour to pray.

10.verse: And he became hungry and was wanting to eat. And while they were preparing it, a trance came upon him.

11.verse: And he sees the heaven having been opened and a certain object like a large sheet coming down, being let down by four corners on the ground—

12.verse: in which were all the four-footed-animals and reptiles of the earth, and birds of the heaven.

13.verse: And a voice came to him, “Having arisen, Peter, slaughter and eat!”

14.verse: But Peter said, “By no means, Lord, because I never ate anything defiled and unclean”.

15.verse: And a voice again came to him for a second time, “The things which God made-clean, don’t you be making-defiled”.

16.verse: And this took place three-times, and immediately the object was taken-up into heaven.

17.verse: The Spirit Tells Peter He Has Sent Three Men, And He Is To Go With Them - Now while Peter was being greatly-perplexed within himself as to what the vision which he saw might mean, behold— the men having been sent-forth by Cornelius, having asked-repeatedly as to the house of Simon, stood at the gate.

18.verse: And having called, they were inquiring, “Is Simon, the one being called Peter, lodging here?”

19.verse: And while Peter was pondering about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold— three men are seeking you.

20.verse: But having arisen, go down and proceed with them not doubting at all, because I have sent them forth”.

21.verse: And Peter, having gone down to the men, said, “Behold— I am the one whom you are seeking. What is the reason for which you are-here?”

22.verse: And the ones said, “Cornelius— a centurion, a righteous man, and one fearing God, and one being attested by the whole nation of the Jews— was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house and to listen-to words from you”.

23.verse: Then having invited them in, he gave-them-lodging. Peter Goes To Cornelius. Peter Now Understands That His Vision Pertained To Gentiles -And on the next day, having arisen, he went forth with them. And some of the brothers from Joppa went with him.

24.verse: And on the next day, he entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius was expecting them, having called together his relatives and close friends.

25.verse: And when Peter’s entering the house came about, Cornelius— having met him, having fallen at his feet— paid-homage.

26.verse: But Peter raised him, saying, “Stand up. I myself also am a man”.

27.verse: And while conversing-with him, he went in and finds many having come-together.

28.verse: And he said to them, “You know how it is unlawful for a Jewish man to be joining or coming-to a foreigner. And-yet God showed me that I should be calling no person defiled or unclean.

29.verse: Therefore, having been sent-for, I indeed came without-objection. So I ask, for what reason did you send-for me?”

30.verse: And Cornelius said, “Four days ago at this hour, I was praying in my house at the ninth hour, and behold— a man stood before me in shining clothing.

31.verse: And he says, ‘Cornelius, your prayer was heard, and your acts-of-almsgiving were remembered before God.

32.verse: Therefore send to Joppa, and summon Simon, who is called Peter. This one is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, beside the sea’.

33.verse: Therefore I sent to you at-once, and you did well, having come. So now we are all here before God to hear all the things having been commanded you by the Lord”.

34.verse: Peter Begins Proclaiming The Gospel To Cornelius - And Peter, having opened his mouth, said, “I understand, in accordance with [God’s] truth, that God is not a respecter-of-persons,

35.verse: but in every nation, the one fearing Him and working righteousness is acceptable to Him.

36.verse: As to the message which He sent-forth to the sons of Israel announcing-the-good-news-of peace through Jesus Christ, this One is Lord of all.

37.verse: You know the matter having taken place throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism which John proclaimed,

38.verse: as to Jesus from Nazareth— how God anointed Him with the Holy Spirit and with power; Who went about doing-good and healing all the ones being oppressed by the devil, because God was with Him.

39.verse: And we are witnesses of everything which He did both in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem; Whom indeed they killed, having hung Him on a cross.

40.verse: God raised this One on the third day, and granted that He become visible—

41.verse: not to all the people, but to witnesses having been chosen-beforehand by God; to us, who ate with and drank with Him after He rose-up from the dead.

42.verse: And He commanded us to proclaim to the people, and to solemnly-warn that this One is the One having been designated by God as judge of the living and the dead.

43.verse: All the prophets testify concerning this One, that everyone believing in Him receives forgiveness of sins through His name”.

44.verse: While Peter Is Speaking, The Spirit Falls On These Gentiles Just Like At Pentecost - While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all the ones hearing the message.

45.verse: And the believers of the circumcision— all-who came with Peter— were astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured-out also on the Gentiles!

46.verse: For they were hearing them speaking in tongues and magnifying God. Then Peter responded,

47.verse: “No one is able to forbid the water so that these may not be baptized, is he?— who received the Holy Spirit as also we did.

48.verse: And he commanded that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay some days.

1.verse: Back In Jerusalem, Peter Explains How God Gave The Identical Gift To The Gentiles - Now the apostles and the brothers being throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also accepted the word of God.

2.verse: But when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the ones of the circumcision were disputing with him,

3.verse: saying that “You went in to men having uncircumcision, and you ate with them”.

4.verse: But having begun, Peter was explaining it to them in-order, saying,

5.verse: “I was in the city of Joppa praying. And in a trance, I saw a vision— a certain object like a large sheet coming down, being let down by four corners from heaven. And it came to me,

6.verse: into which having looked-intently, I was observing. And I saw the four-footed-animals of the earth, and the wild-beasts, and the reptiles, and the birds of the heaven.

7.verse: And I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Having arisen, Peter, slaughter and eat!’

8.verse: But I said, ‘By no means, Lord, because a defiled or unclean thing never entered into my mouth’.

9.verse: But a voice responded for a second time from heaven, ‘The things which God made-clean, don’t you be making-defiled’.

10.verse: And this took place three times, and everything was pulled-up again into heaven.

11.verse: And behold— three men immediately stood at the house in which we were staying, having been sent forth from Caesarea to me.

12.verse: And the Spirit told me to go-with them, having made no distinction. And these six brothers also went with me. And we entered into the house of the man.

13.verse: And he reported to us how he saw the angel having stood in his house, and having said, ‘Send-forth to Joppa, and send-for Simon, the one being called Peter,

14.verse: who will speak words to you by which you will be saved— you and all your household’.

15.verse: And at my beginning to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them just as also upon us at the beginning.

16.verse: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how He was saying, ‘John baptized with water— but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit!’

17.verse: Therefore if God gave the identical gift to them as also to us— [we both] having put faith upon the Lord Jesus Christ— who was I to be able to forbid God?”

18.verse: And having heard these things, they were quiet. And they glorified God, saying, “Then God granted the repentance leading-to life to the Gentiles also!”

19.verse: Many Gentiles Believe In Antioch. Barnabas And Saul Teach These Christians - Now indeed the ones having been dispersed because of the affliction having taken place over Stephen went as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews only.

20.verse: But there were some of them— Cyprian and Cyrenian men— who, having come to Antioch, were speaking also to the Hellenists, announcing-as-good-news the Lord Jesus.

21.verse: And the hand of the Lord was with them. And a large number, having believed, turned to the Lord.

22.verse: And the word about them was heard in the ears of the church existing in Jerusalem. And they sent out Barnabas to go to Antioch—

23.verse: who, having arrived and having seen the grace of God, rejoiced. And he was encouraging everyone to be continuing-in the Lord with purpose of heart,

24.verse: because he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a considerable crowd was added to the Lord.

25.verse: And he went forth to Tarsus to search-for Saul.

26.verse: And having found him, he brought him to Antioch. And it came about for them that for a whole year they were gathered-together in the church and taught a considerable crowd; and that the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

27.verse: Agabas Comes And Predicts A Famine; Barnabas And Saul Take Relief To Judea - And during these days, prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

28.verse: And having stood up, one of them, Agabus by name, signified through the Spirit that there would-certainly be a great famine over the whole world— which took place in-the-time-of Claudius.

29.verse: And as any of the disciples was prospering, each of them determined to send money for a ministry to the brothers dwelling in Judea—

30.verse: which they also did, having sent it forth to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.

1.verse: During This Time, King Herod Kills The Apostle James And Imprisons Peter - And about that time, Herod the king put hands on some of the ones from the church to mistreat them.

2.verse: And he killed James, the brother of John, with a sword.

3.verse: And having seen that it was pleasing to the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also (now the days of the Feast of Unleavened-Bread were taking place)—

4.verse: whom indeed having seized, he put into prison, having handed him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending to bring him up to the people after the Passover [Feast].

5.verse: So indeed Peter was being kept in the prison. And prayer was fervently being made by the church to God for him.

6.verse: An Angel Releases Peter - And when Herod was about to bring him forth, on that night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, having been bound with two chains. And guards in front of the door were keeping-watch-over the prison.

7.verse: And behold— an angel of the Lord stood near, and light shined in the cell. And having struck the side of Peter, he woke him, saying, “Arise quickly”. And his chains fell off of his hands.

8.verse: And the angel said to him, “Gird-yourself and tie-on your sandals”. And he did so. And he says to him, “Put-on your cloak and be following me”.

9.verse: And having gone forth, he was following. And he did not know that the thing taking place by-means-of the angel was real, but he was thinking that he was seeing a vision.

10.verse: And having gone through a first guard-post and a second, they came to the iron gate leading into the city, which by-itself was opened for them. And having gone out, they went ahead one lane, and immediately the angel departed from him.

11.verse: Peter Goes To The House of The Mother of John Mark, Where They Were Praying - And Peter, having become within himself, said, “Now I know truly that the Lord sent-out His angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod, and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews”.

12.verse: And having become-aware, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John (the one being called Mark), where there were many assembled-together and praying.

13.verse: And he having knocked-on the door of the gate, a servant-girl went to it to answer— Rhoda by name.

14.verse: And having recognized the voice of Peter, because of her joy she did not open the gate, but having run in, she reported that Peter was standing in front of the gate.

15.verse: But the ones said to her, “You are mad”. But the one was insisting that it was holding so. But the ones were saying, “It is his angel”.

16.verse: But Peter was continuing-on knocking. And having opened, they saw him and were astonished.

17.verse: And having motioned to them with his hand to be silent, he related to them how the Lord led him out of the prison. And he said, “Report these things to James and the brothers”. And having gone out, he proceeded to another place.

18.verse: When Peter Can’t Be Found, The Guards Are Executed. Herod Dies In Caesarea - Now having become day, there was no small disturbance among the soldiers as to what then became of Peter.

19.verse: And Herod, having searched-for him and not having found him, having examined the guards, ordered that they be led away. And having gone down from Judea to Caesarea, he was spending-time there.

20.verse: Now he was being very-angry with the Tyrians and Sidonians. And they were coming to him with-one-accord. And having won-over Blastus, the one over the bedroom of the king, they were asking-for peace, because of their country being provided-for from the royal land.

21.verse: And on an appointed day, Herod— having put on the royal clothing, and having sat on the judgment-seat— was giving-a-public-address to them.

22.verse: And the public-assembly was calling-out, “The voice of a god and not of a man!”

23.verse: And at once an angel of the Lord struck him because he did not give the glory to God. And having become eaten-by-worms, he expired.

24.verse: Barnabas And Saul Return To Antioch From Judea, With John Mark - But the word of God was growing and being multiplied.

25.verse: And Barnabas and Saul returned, having fulfilled the ministry to Jerusalem, having taken along John with them (the one having been called Mark).

1.verse: While Teaching In Antioch, The Spirit Sends Saul And Barnabas On a Missionary Journey - Now there were prophets and teachers at Antioch in the church existing there— Barnabas and Simeon (the one being called Niger) and Lucius the Cyrenian, and Manaen (one brought-up-with Herod the tetrarch) and Saul.

2.verse: And while they were ministering to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Separate now Barnabas and Saul for Me, for the work which I have called them to”.

3.verse: Then, having fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.

4.verse: On Cyprus, Bar-Jesus The Magician Is Blinded, Sergius Paulus The Proconsul Believes - So indeed, having been sent-out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia, and from there sailed-away to Cyprus.

5.verse: And having come-to-be in Salamis, they were proclaiming the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they also were having John as an assistant.

6.verse: And having gone through the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a certain man who was a magician, a Jewish false-prophet for whom the name was Bar-Jesus—

7.verse: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. This one, having summoned Barnabas and Saul, sought to hear the word of God.

8.verse: But the magician Elymas (for so his name is translated) was opposing them, seeking to turn away the proconsul from the faith.

9.verse: But Saul (the one also called Paul), having been filled with the Holy Spirit, having looked-intently at him,

10.verse: said “O son of the devil full of all deceit and all villainy, enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease perverting the straight ways of the Lord?

11.verse: And now, behold— the hand of the Lord is upon you and you shall be blind, not seeing the sun for a time”. And at-once mistiness and darkness fell upon him. And going around, he was seeking ones-leading-by-the-hand.

12.verse: Then the proconsul, having seen the thing having taken place, believed, being astounded at the teaching of the Lord.

13.verse: In Perga John Mark Leaves. Paul And Barnabas Go On To Pisidian Antioch - And having put-to-sea from Paphos, the ones around Paul came to Perga of Pamphylia. But John, having departed from them, returned to Jerusalem.

14.verse: But they, having gone through from Perga, arrived at Pisidian Antioch. And having entered into the synagogue on the day of the Sabbath, they sat-down.

15.verse: And after the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue-officials sent forth a message to them, saying, “Men, brothers, if there is any word of exhortation among you for the people, speak”.

16.verse: Paul Proclaims That John Announced The Coming of The Davidic Savior, Jesus - And Paul, having stood up, and having motioned with his hand, said “Men, Israelites, and the ones fearing God: listen.

17.verse: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers. And He lifted-up the people during the stay in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm led them out of it.

18.verse: And for about a forty year period He put-up-with them in the wilderness.

19.verse: And having brought-down seven nations in the land of Canaan, He gave them their land as-an-inheritance

20.verse: about in [a total of] four-hundred and fifty years. And after these things He gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

21.verse: And from there they asked-for a king. And God gave them Saul— the son of Kish, a man from the tribe of Benjamin— for forty years.

22.verse: And having removed him, He raised-up David for them for a king— concerning whom also having testified, He said, ‘I found David the son of Jesse, a man in-accordance-with My heart, who will do all My desires’.

23.verse: From the seed of this one, in accordance with the promise, God brought a Savior for Israel, Jesus—

24.verse: John having publicly-proclaimed a baptism of repentance for all the people of Israel before the presence of His coming.

25.verse: And as John was completing his course, he was saying, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not the One. But behold— He is coming after me, of Whom I am not worthy to untie the sandal of His feet’.

26.verse: Fulfilling The Scriptures, The Rulers Killed Jesus And God Raised Him Up - “Men, brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and the ones among you fearing God: the message of this salvation was sent-out to us.

27.verse: For the ones dwelling in Jerusalem and their rulers, not having known this One and the voices of the prophets being read every Sabbath— having condemned Him, fulfilled them.

28.verse: And having found no charge worthy of death, they asked Pilate that He be executed.

29.verse: And when they fulfilled all the things having been written about Him, having taken Him down from the cross, they laid Him in a tomb.

30.verse: But God raised Him from the dead—

31.verse: Who appeared for many days to the ones having come up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who now are His witnesses to the people.

32.verse: And we are announcing-as-good-news-to you the promise having been made to the fathers—

33.verse: that God has fulfilled this promise for us their children, having raised-up Jesus, as it has also been written in the second Psalm: ‘You are My Son. Today I have fathered You’ [Ps 2:7].

34.verse: And that He raised Him up from the dead as One no longer going to return to decay, He has spoken in this manner [in Isa 55:3]: that ‘I will give You the holy, trustworthy things of  David’.

35.verse: Therefore also in another place it says, ‘You will not give Your holy One to see decay’ [Ps 16:10].

36.verse: For David, having served the purpose of God in his own generation, fell asleep and was put-with his fathers, and saw decay.

37.verse: But He Whom God raised did not see decay.

38.verse: Forgiveness Is Now Being Proclaimed To You. Don’t Be Scoffers - “Therefore let it be known to you, men, brothers, that through this One forgiveness of sins is being proclaimed to you. And from all things from which you could not be declared-righteous by the Law of Moses—

39.verse: by this One everyone believing is declared-righteous.

40.verse: Therefore be watching-out that the thing having been spoken in the Prophets [in Hab 1:5] may not come upon you:

41.verse: ‘Look, scoffers, and marvel and perish. Because I am working a work in your days, a work which you will never believe if someone tells you in detail’”.

42.verse: At The Next Sabbath Meeting, The Jews Contradict Paul. He Turns To The Gentiles - And while they were going out, they were begging that these words might be spoken to them on the next Sabbath.

43.verse: And the gathering having been released, many of the Jews and of the worshiping proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas— who, speaking to them, were persuading them to continue-in the grace of God.

44.verse: Now on the coming Sabbath, almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of the Lord.

45.verse: But the Jews, having seen the crowds, were filled with jealousy. And they were contradicting the things being spoken by Paul, blaspheming.

46.verse: And Paul and Barnabas, having spoken-boldly, said, “It was necessary that the word of God be spoken to you first. Since you are rejecting it and judging yourselves not worthy of eternal life, behold— we are turning to the Gentiles.

47.verse: For thus the Lord has commanded us [in Isa 49:6]: ‘I have placed you for a light to the Gentiles, that you may be a light for salvation as far as the last place of the earth’”.

48.verse: And the Gentiles, having heard it, were rejoicing and glorifying the word of the Lord. And all who had been appointed to eternal life believed.

49.verse: The Jews Drive Paul And Barnabas Out of Their Districts - And the word of the Lord was being carried through the whole region.

50.verse: But the Jews incited the prominent worshiping women and the leading men of the city, and aroused a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out from their districts.

51.verse: But the ones, having shaken-out the dust from their feet against them, went to Iconium.

52.verse: And the disciples were being filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.

1.verse: In Iconium, Paul And Barnabas Again Proclaim, And Then Flee a Plot To Kill Them - Now it came about in Iconium that according to the same plan, they entered into the synagogue of the Jews and spoke in this manner, so that a large number of both Jews and Greeks believed.

2.verse: But the Jews having disobeyed aroused and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers.

3.verse: So indeed they spent a considerable time speaking-boldly for the Lord, Who was testifying to the word of His grace, granting that signs and wonders be taking place by their hands.

4.verse: And the multitude of the city was divided— indeed some were with the Jews; and others with the apostles.

5.verse: But when an attempt came about by both the Gentiles and Jews together with their rulers to mistreat and to stone them,

6.verse: having become-aware, they fled to the cities of Lycaonia— Lystra and Derbe, and the surrounding-region.

7.verse: And there they were announcing-the-good-news.

8.verse: In Lystra, Paul Heals a Man And Is Declared a God, Then Is Stoned - And in Lystra, a certain man powerless in the feet was sitting— a lame one from his mother’s womb, who never walked.

9.verse: This one heard Paul speaking— who, having looked-intently at him, and having seen that he had faith that he might be restored,

10.verse: said with a loud voice, “Stand up straight on your feet”. And he leaped and was walking.

11.verse: And the crowds, having seen what Paul did, raised their voice, saying in Lycaonian, “The gods came down to us, having become-like men!”

12.verse: And they were calling Barnabas “Zeus”, and Paul “Hermes”, since he was the one leading the speaking.

13.verse: And the priest of the temple of Zeus being before the city, having brought bulls and garlands to the gates, was intending to offer-sacrifice with the crowds.

14.verse: But the apostles, Barnabas and Paul— having heard-of it, having torn their garments— leaped-out into the crowd, crying-out

15.verse: and saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men of-like-nature to you, announcing-the-good-news to turn you from these worthless things to the living God, Who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all the things in them,

16.verse: Who allowed all the nations to be going their ways in the generations having gone-by.

17.verse: And yet He did not leave Himself without-witness: doing-good, giving you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness”.

18.verse: And saying these things, with-difficulty they restrained the crowds, that they might not offer-sacrifice to them.

19.verse: But Jews came-over from Antioch and Iconium. And having won-over the crowds, and having stoned Paul, they were dragging him outside of the city, thinking that he was dead.

20.verse: But the disciples having surrounded him— having stood-up, he entered into the city. In Derbe They Make Disciples, Then Return Home, Strengthening The Churches -And on the next day he went forth with Barnabas to Derbe.

21.verse: And having announced-the-good-news-to that city, and having made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch,

22.verse: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue-in the faith, and that “It-is-necessary that we enter into the kingdom of God through many afflictions”.

23.verse: And having appointed elders for them in each church, having prayed with fastings, they commended them to the Lord in Whom they had believed.

24.verse: And having gone through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

25.verse: And having spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

26.verse: And from there they sailed-away to Antioch— from where they had been handed-over to the grace of God for the work which they completed.

27.verse: And having arrived, and having gathered together the church, they were reporting all that God did with them, and that He opened a door of faith to the Gentiles.
